snippet: A Saudi Arabian writer who flew to Malaysia amid calls for his execution after he posted messages considered blasphemous will likely be repatriated, authorities said.
abstract: Malaysian authorities say that Hamza Kashgari, Saudi writer who fled the kingdom amid calls for his execution after he posted Twitter messages considered insulting to the Prophet Muhammad, will most likely be repatriated.

byline.original: By LIZ GOOCH and J. DAVID GOODMAN
byline.contributor: Liz Gooch reported from Kuala Lumpur and J. David Goodman from New York.

lead_paragraph: A Saudi Arabian writer who flew to Malaysia amid calls for his execution after he posted messages considered blasphemous will likely be repatriated, authorities said.

headline.seo: Hamza Kashgari, a Saudi Writer, Detained in Malaysia Over Twitter Posts
headline.main: Malaysia Detains Saudi Over Twitter Posts on Prophet
headline.print_headline: Malaysia: Saudi Man to Be Repatriated
